class bcolors¶

Bases: object

Class that defines the colors used in OPSE display.

core.utils.DataTypeInput module¶

class DataTypeInput¶

Bases: object

Class that defines the possible input data for a tool. It allows developers to define what input data will be useful for their tools. Also it normalizes OPSE as developers use these variables and not hard-coded strings.

ACCOUNT = 'ACCOUNT'¶
ADRESSE = 'ADRESSE'¶
AGE = 'AGE'¶
BIRTHDATE = 'BIRTHDATE'¶
DEATHDATE = 'DEATHDATE'¶
EMAIL = 'EMAIL'¶
FIRSTNAME = 'FIRSTNAME'¶
GENDER = 'GENDER'¶
IP = 'IP'¶
LASTNAME = 'LASTNAME'¶
LOCATION = 'LOCATION'¶
MIDDLENAME = 'MIDDLENAME'¶
ORGANIZATION = 'ORGANIZATION'¶
PHONE_NUMBER = 'PHONE_NUMBER'¶
USERNAME = 'USERNAME'¶

core.utils.DataTypeOutput module¶

class DataTypeOutput¶

Bases: object

Class that defines the possible output data for a tool. It allows developers to define what output data will be useful for their tools. Also it normalizes OPSE as developers use these variables and not hard-coded strings.

ACCOUNT = 'ACCOUNT'¶
ADDRESS = 'ADDRESS'¶
AGE = 'AGE'¶
BIRTHDATE = 'BIRTHDATE'¶
DEATHDATE = 'DEATHDATE'¶
EMAIL = 'EMAIL'¶
FIRSTNAME = 'FIRSTNAME'¶
GENDER = 'GENDER'¶
IP = 'IP'¶
LASTNAME = 'LASTNAME'¶
LOCATION = 'LOCATION'¶
MIDDLENAME = 'MIDDLENAME'¶
ORGANIZATION = 'ORGANIZATION'¶
PHONE_NUMBER = 'PHONE_NUMBER'¶
PICTURE = 'PICTURE'¶
POLITICAL_ORIENTATION = 'POLITICAL_ORIENTATION'¶
USERNAME = 'USERNAME'¶

core.utils.Task module¶

class Task(self)¶

Bases: abc.ABC, threading.Thread

Class that represents a task during OPSE execution. It is used by the Tool class and the Api class.

abstract execute()¶

Method representing the task’s job.

This method should be override in each Task.

classmethod get_tasks() → list[T]¶

Return the list of all the tasks instantiated.

Returns

List of instantiated tasks.

Return type

list[Task]

interrupt()¶

Interrupt the current Task.

This method throws a TaskInterrupt into the current Task to stop it.

is_running() → bool¶

Return whether the task is running or not.

This method allows developers to know if the current Task is still running. It is recommended to use join method to wait until the task ends.

run()¶

Method representing the task’s activity. Overloads the thread’s run method.

It adds error and interruption management. Each Task can interrupt or be interrupted during execution (see TaskInterrupt for more details).

core.utils.make_research module¶

make_research(target_firstname: str, target_middlename: str, target_lastname: str, target_gender: str, target_birthdate: str, target_age: str, target_address: list[str], target_phone: list[str], target_email: list[str], target_username: list[str], start_research: bool = True) → classes.Research.Research¶

Function that makes a research from target’s information.

Parameters

  • target_firstname (str) – First name of the target.

  • target_middlename (str) – Middle name of the target.

  • target_lastname (str) – Last name of the target.

  • target_gender (str) – Gender of the target.

  • target_birthdate (str) – Birth date of the target.

  • target_age (str) – Age of the target.

  • target_address (list[str]) – Address of the target.

  • target_phone (list[str]) – Phone number of the target.

  • target_email (list[str]) – Email of the target.

  • target_username (list[str]) – Username of the target.

  • start_research (bool, optional) – Setting to start the research, defaults to True.

Returns

The research containing profiles.

Return type

Research

core.utils.signals module¶

previous()¶

Function that raise a PreviousException.

Raises

PreviousException – CTRL-C Exception.

reset(clear: bool = True)¶

Function that resets environnement.

It stops properly all tasks and clear stdout.

Parameters

clear (bool, optional) – Set display erasing, defaults to True.

core.utils.utils module¶

clear()¶

Clear stdout.

get_dict_key_by_index(dictionary: dict, index: int) → any¶

Function that returns a key stored at a specific index in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • dictionary (dict) – The dictionary.

  • index (int) – The index of the wanted key.

Returns

The key stored at the index.

Return type

any

get_int(msg: str = '') → int¶

Helper to get an integer from a user input.

It handles integer input basic errors.

Parameters

msg (str, optional) – The message to display before the input, defaults to “”.

Returns

The integer from the input.

Return type

int

get_today_date(format: str = '%d/%m/%Y') → str¶

Function that returns today’s date in a specific format.

See today() and strftime() for more details.

Parameters

format (str, optional) – The format wanted, defaults to “%d/%m/%Y”.

Returns

A string containing today’s date.

Return type

str

init_log_path()¶

Function that initializes the log directory path if it doesn’t exist.

is_url_image(image_url: str) → bool¶

Function that tests if a URL is pointing to an image.

The supported image formats are PNG, JPG and JPEG.

Parameters

image_url (str) – The URL to test.

Returns

True if the URL points to an image, else False.

Return type

bool

is_valid_date(date_str: str, format: str = '%d/%m/%Y') → bool¶

Function that tests the validity of a date in a specific format.

Parameters

  • date_str (str) – The date to test.

  • format (str, optional) – The date format, defaults to “%d/%m/%Y”.

Returns

True if the date is correct, else False.

Return type

bool

print_debug(msg: str = '')¶

Function that displays a debug message.

Parameters

msg (str, optional) – The message to display, defaults to “”.

print_error(msg: str = '', on_debug_only: bool = False)¶

Function that displays an error message.

Parameters

  • msg (str, optional) – The message to display, defaults to “”.

  • on_debug_only (bool, optional) – Setting to display only in debug, defaults to False.

print_log(msg: str = '', log_level: int = 20, display: bool = True)¶

Function that manage logs. It is used to log message and display them on stdout during execution.

See logging for more details.

Parameters

  • msg (str, optional) – The message to log, defaults to “”

  • log_level (int, optional) – The logging level, defaults to INFO.

  • display (bool, optional) – Setting to display log message on stdout, defaults to True.

print_sucess(msg: str = '', on_debug_only: bool = False)¶

Function that displays a success message.

Parameters

  • msg (str, optional) – The message to display, defaults to “”.

  • on_debug_only (bool, optional) – Setting to display only in debug, defaults to False.

print_title(msg: str = '')¶

Function that displays a title message.

Parameters

msg (str, optional) – The message to display, defaults to “”.

print_warning(msg: str = '', on_debug_only: bool = False)¶

Function that displays a warning message.

Parameters

  • msg (str, optional) – The message to display, defaults to “”.

  • on_debug_only (bool, optional) – Setting to display only in debug, defaults to False.

remove_plural(plural_word: str) → str¶

Function that removes plural in English words.

Parameters

plural_word (str) – The word in the plural.

Returns

A word in singular.

Return type

str

show(dictionary: dict, depth: list[bool], name: str = 'Name') → str¶

Function that builds a string as a tree to display complex object structures.

This function is recursive. The dictionary used should not point to itself and its attributes should not loop to themselves.

Parameters

  • dictionary (dict) – The dictionary to convert.

  • depth (list[bool]) – The current depth of the call.

  • name (str, optional) – The name of the current dictionary, defaults to “Name”.

Returns

A string representation of the dictionary.

Return type

str

to_dict(obj: object, display_none_value: bool = False) → dict¶

Function that builds a dictionary from complex object structures.

Parameters

  • obj (object) – The object to transform.

  • display_none_value (bool, optional) – Setting to continue displaying None attributes values, defaults to False.

Returns

A dictionary containing the object.

Return type

dict

whoami(depth: int = 2) → str¶

Function that returns a whoami’s function tag for debugging.

The tag contains the name of the current function and its file.

For example, if the print_debug() function is called in main() function in Opse.py, it would return “[Opse:main]”.

Parameters

depth (int, optional) – Depth of the function call, defaults to 2.

Returns

A string containing file name and function name.

Return type

str
